content.title: Pronunciation Practice - Travel & Weather
content.instructions: Practice travel and weather vocabulary. Focus on accurate vowel sounds and word stress.
focusPoints: Stress patterns in compound words (air-PORT, SUIT-case)

targetSentences.text: I'd like to book a room for two nights.
targetSentences.phonetic: /aɪd laɪk tuː bʊk ə ruːm fɔː tuː naɪts/

targetSentences.text: The weather is sunny and warm today.
targetSentences.phonetic: /ðə ˈweðər ɪz ˈsʌni ænd wɔːm təˈdeɪ/

targetSentences.text: What time does the flight depart?

content.prompt: Imagine you're at a hotel reception. Check in and ask about the facilities. Mention the weather too.
content.expectedResponse: Hello, I have a reservation for two nights under the name Smith. Can you tell me what time breakfast is served? Also, what's the weather forecast for tomorrow? I'd like to visit the beach.
hints: Ask about hotel facilities or services
Include a comment about the weather
